Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time at her residence in north Edmonton, Alberta. Later that day, Nadia’s abandon vehicle was discovered in some bushes down the side of a hill entering Rundle Park.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2014005716.CaseDesc: Maria MARIN left her personal belongings at Johnsons Lake near Wasa, British Columbia and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2023064298.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2023, Rebecca Harbowy was last seen after walking away from the Ridge Meadows Hospital on a surveillance camera at 02:05 a.m. walking on the 22800 Block of the Haney Bypass in Ridge Meadows, British Columbia. Rebecca has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Grey, Zip up hoodie with large Nike logo across the chest area
Pants: Black, Sweatpants with PUMA white logo on the lower leg
Shoes: Black, White, Black runners with white rim
Tattoo: Pelvis, Two doves on each side of pelvis/front hip area
Torso (Front), Large writing on each side of upper torso
Front Of Neck, Two roses on each side

Case reference: 2014005069.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2008, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Kien Hua was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Kien had told his friend that he was going to borrow his parents' car and was leaving town for a couple of days. On March 4, 2008, his parents' vehicle was found abandoned in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014005363.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1986, Edward Beauchamp failed to meet with his probation officer for a scheduled appointment in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Born To Be Wild"
Left Forearm, "Born to Raise Hell 1952 Eddie"
Right Hand, "Love" on backs of fingers
Left Hand, Club, diamond, spade and heart on knuckles
Left Hand, "Hate" on backs of fingers
Right Forearm, Cobra and tumbleweed chief
Right Upper Arm, "Born to be free"

Case reference: 2014002223.CaseDesc: Edward Joseph Arcand left his residence in Coleman, Alberta on June 8, 1975, driving a 1969 Ford Falcon station wagon.  On June 15, 1975 his vehicle was found abandoned 80 km north of Coleman on highway 940.  Edward has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000048.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2002, Mendes Joseph was seen for the last time at his apartment located in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Van had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2014006341.CaseDesc: Alma Mae Gillespie has been missing since June 10th, 1996 from her residence in Winnipeg, MB. Prior to her disappearance, she talked of wanting to go away and disappear for a while.  This has been done on numerous occasions before, even for years at a time.  In the past she has resurfaced within either the United States or Canada.

Case reference: 2021059094.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2021, Leslie Peesker was last seen riding his gold Kona 10-speed bicycle with saddle bags and tent at the intersection of Highway 11 and Highway 312, in Rosthern, Saskatchewan. His family reported that he was on his way to Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. Leslie has been known to camp outdoors for extended periods of time, but having no communication with his family is out of character for him.

Case reference: 2014004588.CaseDesc: On November 23, 1986, Pierre-Jean Durocher was last seen. He was reported missing on November 25, 1986, by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. Durocher lived in a rooming house in Longueuil. His backpack containing his identification was found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge in Montreal.

Case reference: 2009002699.CaseDesc: Norman Welsh was on holidays with his mother and an incident occurred on July 18, 1976, which subsequently led him to the hospital. While in the hospital he was described as bitter and un-cooperative wanting to return home in St Catharines. While being escorted to the North Bay Pyschiatric Hospital (now Northeast Mental Health Centre), he ran off into the wooded area.

Teeth: Stained, Has a 2 tooth partial plate and is missing his front upper left tooth, teeth slightly stained
Scar: Head, Under the hair, due to an operation at the age of 16

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2012020056.CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.

Other: Abdomen, Was 6-9 months pregnant at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2006026899.CaseDesc: Dr. Kemp left his residence in Sturgeon Falls, on May 19, 1960, to go fishing. On May 20, 1960, he failed to return home and was reported missing. On May 21, 1960, his vehicle was found parked at Finlayson Lake, McLaren Township, District of Nipissing. His canoe and personal belongings were located on the lake.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 2015054215.CaseDesc: On October 03, 1996, James Bruce Hill-Tout, failed to show up for a family dinner in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and disappeared without notice.

Case reference: 2019032078.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2019, at aprroximately 2:19 pm, Shauranne Humphry was seen for the last time at the Anduhyaun Shelter in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000114.CaseDesc: Abigail Andrews, a single Metis woman, lived in a basement suite in Fort St. John. She worked at FSJ Fashions, and The Frontier Bar and Grill. She was pregnant but not yet showing. Abigail was last seen on the evening of April 7, 2010 walking from her home towards a friend's house.

Teeth: Good, Used a dental pallet retainer
Deformity: Right Index Finger, Previously broken and healed in a deformed position

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018040311.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, Karanjeet Singh was seen for the last time as he left with some of his personal belongings to go visit a friend in Toronto, Ontario. Karanjeet was visiting Toronto from India and was due to return on May 24.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2018040962.CaseDesc: Ryan Duncan was last seen on July 17, 2018, at a motel in Lumby, British Columbia, while travelling in the area. Ryan's vehicle was located in Vernon, British Columbia on July 21, 2018.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2014001312.CaseDesc: John McAllister was last seen leaving his home on May 7, 1973. Mr. McAllister's truck was found near Lodgepole, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Lee. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2014003770.CaseDesc: Herbert Gross was to meet his girlfriend for lunch on May 4, 1996. He failed to show up, which was extremely out of character for him. On May 7th, a man described as being Caucasian, in his mid-20s, 5'7 and 140-150 lbs, clean shaven with short, brown hair, was seen moving items from Mr. Gross's suite. This man was wearing a dark shirt, faded jeans and white runners. Police feel Mr. Gross may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014002337.CaseDesc: Timothy Peifer was last seen on the long weekend in September, 2002 in the Caddy Lake area of Manitoba.  Mr. Peifer's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2021057680.CaseDesc:
Frances Gazeley was last seen on the evening of December 7, 2021. She was last
seen in the Weyburn, Saskatchewan area but could also be in the Ceylon, Minton,
Bengough, and Colgate areas. Multiple searches have been completed since Frances was reported missing but she has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2015015784.CaseDesc: Richele Bear was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 5, 2013. She was last seen on August 9, 2013 leaving a residence in the 900 block of Rae Street in the North Central District of Regina, Saskatchewan. Through investigation, we have confirmed Richele to be the victim of a homicide.  Her remains however, have not been located.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, A round inoculation scar (10mm)

Case reference: 2014003731.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1964 at 1:00 p.m. Murray Hansen left Berens River, Manitoba to go to Black River to deliver some items to a family member. At approximately 3:00 p.m. that day it started to storm and the water on the lake became rough. Mr. Hansen planned to stay in Black River overnight and then return to Berens River. When 5 days passed and he hadn't returned home, his wife began to look for him and discovered that he had never arrived in Black River. On November 3, 1964, Mr. Hansen's boat was found turned over near Bigstone Point and was approximately 100 yards from the shore. Searches were done by air, land and boat but the body of Mr. Hansen was never recovered. Murray Hansen is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014001441.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1972, James Cordell was seen for the last time leaving his parents’ residence in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, James was driving a 1970 silver blue Dodge Polar vehicle.  He had a cast on his right arm and his teeth were wired shut as a result of a motor vehicle collision.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, SHRT SLEEV, Mauve and white terrycloth short sleeve

Case reference: 2014003015.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1984 Donald Williamson's brother reported him as missing since September 6th. He has a history of disappearing without maintaining contact with his family. There is no foul play suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2019007755.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2019, Thomas, ‘Tommy’, Jones was seen for the last time travelling in a car with a male acquaintance around the community of Grand Falls-Windsor, Newfoundland. When Thomas did not return home later that evening, he was reported missing. According to the acquaintance, the car had run out of gas while traveling on a forest road behind the local mill. The acquaintance left to walk back to town and Thomas had decided to stay with the car. The car was located on the forest road but Thomas Jones was not located.

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2013000026.CaseDesc: John Antic's wife spoke with him at 11:00 a.m. on November 5, 2012 at a local Burlington mall. Mr. Antic left the mall wearing appropriate clothing for the weather. At approximately 7:30 p.m., Mrs. Antic received a phone call from a woman on behalf of Mr. Antic. She could hear her husband in the background saying he was eating dinner at a restaurant in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mr. Antic's presence at the restaurant was confirmed. It is believed that he was on foot, and is familiar with public transportation. Mr. Antic has had no contact with his family or banking institutions since. There were no pre-existing medical, domestic or mental health issues.

Hair: Grey, Short, Short hair on sides and balding across top
Hat: Black, A black flat topped hat with a brim at front.  No markings.

Case reference: 2018043194.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1990, Laura Hamilton was last seen by her fiancé leaving a restaurant in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003793.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1980, Keith Dufour was seen for the last time at his residence in the town of Amherstburg, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Forehead, Right temple on the forehead

Case reference: 2014005108.CaseDesc: On May 20, 2008, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Zhebglin Park was seen for the last time at his home in the Tom Clove Villa Residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020008707.CaseDesc: On the evening of June 23, 1978, Bonny Ainslie Laframboise was seen for the last time as she went for a walk in Toronto, Ontario. Shortly after midnight, Bonnie called her husband to tell him she was lost.

Case reference: 2008006299.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1960, Willie Ray was reported missing. He had left his residence approximately 3 weeks earlier. It was common for him to go hunting and fishing.  Mr. Ray was reportedly very comfortable living in the outdoors and could sustain himself for quite sometime. There was a 12 gauge shotgun missing from the Ray residence. The boats frequently used by Mr. Ray were all accounted for.

Case reference: 2012020106.CaseDesc: Danielle Boisvert, 18 years old, disappeared November 6, 1979. On that day, Danielle was last seen leaving a bar in Montreal-North, Québec.

Case reference: 2016040859.CaseDesc: On July 19, 2016, Deana Mildred Wertz was last seen at her residence on Yankee Flats Road near Salmon Arm BC. Later that same morning she spoke with family members by phone indicating she was going for a hike without her dog which was unusual. The area where Deanna is believed to have gone is the area surrounding Yankee Flats Rd near Salmon Arm BC which is steep mountainous terrain with a number of trail systems. She left without any personal possessions, cash or identification.

Case reference: 2006012199.CaseDesc: Leonel Phillips left Butterfield Lodge by boat to travel on Lake Matinenda (Blind River, Ontario) to Log Chateau. Mr. Phillips' boat was located adrift but he was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Chest, A burn scar below his right breast

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014004744.CaseDesc: Cyril Detimmerman and a friend left Brandon, Manitoba on the Assiniboine River traveling to Treherne. Cyril was experienced at navigating along this river route, however water conditions at that time had been very high as a result of the spring flooding. The pair soon encountered strong currents and large amounts of debris on the river. In the process of trying to navigate to shore the boat capsized causing both men to enter the water. Both men were wearing life jackets. Extensive searches conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations several miles along the river all with negative results. Mr. Detimmerman was never found and is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2020011797.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1986, John Edwards was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, On left bicep

Case reference: 2017064837.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2017, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Mélissa Blais was seen for the last time in Louiseville, Quebec. Prior to her disappearance, Mélissa had driven to Louiseville’s downtown area in her 2011 black Toyota Corolla, license plate Quebec Y70 FAD, to spend the evening there. Her vehicle has never been found.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Heart and wings; letters "JO"

Case reference: 2006028099.CaseDesc: Diane Marie Bourne was last seen on March 6, 1976, at her residence in Ashton, Ontario. Extensive police investigation has failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2017062421.CaseDesc: Matthew Wiinikainen was seen for the last time on March 30, 1995 in Gaspé, Quebec. Matthew was in detention at the Youth Center “Unité La Rade”, located in Gaspé hospital area, Quebec. He escaped around 11:00 p.m. during the change of the guard.

Case reference: 2014002890.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1983, Bertha Kolachynski was last seen at her residence in the community of Chippawa in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Bertha was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2006025399.CaseDesc: Walter Mesem was last seen on April 25, 1982, driving his vehicle in the Eldorado area. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Mesem.

Coat: Green, Hand knitted cuffs, zippered front

Case reference: 2006023099.CaseDesc: Gordon Zeigler was last seen on January 3, 1991, heading to a camp on Elizabeth Lake, Ontario by snowmobile. Although his snowmobile was located on Lake Nipigon, he was never found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020648.CaseDesc: Andrew Wiebe went missing from his residence in Saskatoon, SK on January 11, 1988. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was later located abandoned in the Anglin Lake District, SK.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carleton Place, Ontario. Carole has lived in Carleton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Québec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2012020113.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2004, Sylvie Menard was reported missing in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. Sylvie was last seen at approximately 1:00 p.m. in a licensed establishment located at the intersection of 3rd Row and Highway 359 (Main Street) in Saint-Luc-de-Vincennes, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood

Case reference: 2023025053.CaseDesc: On May 2nd, 2023, Barry Bedard was seen for the last time in the area of 118 Avenue and 50 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, Barry was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal design & "ALPHA" in old English

Case reference: 2013000099.CaseDesc: William Andersen and a co-worker were designated to conduct a wildlife survey in northern Manitoba. The men had flown into North Indian Lake on June 26th and departed by canoe from there. On the second day when the men attempted to shoot some rapids, their canoe hit a rock which overturned, throwing both men into the river. Mr. Andersen was not seen again. Air and land searches failed to locate Mr. Andersen and he is presumed dead as a result of drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Scar: 1" long scar 3/8" wide on the back of either the left or right hand.

Case reference: 2020007777.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1972, at approximately 3:30 am, Dina Kriba was last seen near 843 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014005425.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2010, at approximately 6:00 a.m., Tong-kok Lam was seen for the last time by her husband as he left their home to go to work. When Tong-kok’s husband returned, she and some of her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2020033565.CaseDesc: Eddie Ryan Burwell was last seen in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan in 2018. His last known banking activity was in Toronto, Ontario in May 2018. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020096.CaseDesc: On September 17, 2008, Kevin Michel was with two other people at Usinne Lake, near Creighton, Saskatchewan, harvesting rice. Witnesses state Kevin walked away from their camp for reasons unknown. Extensive ground, air and water searches were conducted in the area but failed to locate Kevin.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Kevin heart bombers" (text) or "Kevin (heart symbol) bombers"

Case reference: 2013000142.CaseDesc: Richard Dryland was known to be homeless in the Grande Prairie, Alberta area. Mr. Dryland lived a transient lifestyle and often travelled to BC. In November 1993, he was released from the Peace River Correctional Centre. His family has not heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Heart and dagger

Case reference: 2020011537.CaseDesc: On February 11, 1985, Veronica Butch was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Veronica had moved out of the apartment that she shared with her boyfriend and she was supposed to move in with her sister, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2014005541.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2010, Shawn Smith was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. On September 6, Shawn arrived in the Dominican Republic and was scheduled to return on the September 12, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2014003567.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2001, Jocelyn Gadoury was seen for the last time when he left his home in Laval, Quebec to go to his garage in Saint-Eustache, Quebec. Jocelyn has not been seen or heard from since.

Sweater: White, T Shirt, With writing "PATRON DE ZAPET"

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2014004260.CaseDesc: Louis Valentine was last seen in August 2000 with friends in Laval, Quebec. Louis, a former resident of Laval, had won a large sum of money in the lottery in December 1999 and the following month he moved to Trois-Rivières.

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2006010999.CaseDesc: It is believed that Sander Lingman became lost while staking claims near Gripp Lake, 69 kilometres north west of Nakina, Ontario. They were unable to find Mr Lingman, despite intensive searches of the area.

Case reference: 2020011471.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, at approximately 9:00 am, Stella Zayats was last seen by her husband as she left her residence to go for a walk in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.
